intro: Aristotelia papuana, commonly known as the New Zealand kōwhai, is a small evergreen tree native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Elaeocarpaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemose inflorescences. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, edible pulp. The plant is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
